ch.artecat.grengine

Class Grengine

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.artecat.grengine.BaseGrengine
      • ch.artecat.grengine.Grengine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class Grengine
extends BaseGrengine
    Grengine.

    See BaseGrengine for most convenience methods for using Grengine.

    The matrix for running scripts is as follows:

    • run(<loader>,<source>,<binding>)
    • <loader>: can be a specific loader or be omitted for the default loader
    • <source>: can be an instance of source or indicated by script text, file or URL
    • <binding>: can be an instance of Binding, a map or be omitted for an empty binding

    Examples:

    • run("println 'hello world!'"): default loader, text-based source, empty binding
    • run(myLoader, new URL("http://acme.org/myScript.groovy", myBinding): given loader, URL-based source, given binding

    The matrices for loading classes, creating script instances and for creating sources are similar:

    • load(<loader>,<source>)
    • create(<loader>,<source>)
    • source(<source>)

    Grengine performance:

    • In my experience it is crucial to measure performance under circumstances that come as close as possible to the actual application.
    • What can be said independently of actual circumstances is:
      • Compiling a very simple script is of the order of milliseconds.
      • Running it with Grengine by script text or script file is of the order of microseconds (except for the first run or other circumstances where (re-)compilation is mandated).
      • Running it from an already created instance of Script is of the order of nanoseconds.
    • Run the GrengineVisualPerformanceTest and see the options of DefaultSourceFactory.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alain Stalder, Made in Switzerland.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Grengine.Builder
      Builder for instances of Grengine.
      static class  Grengine.Grape
      Convenience class for easily getting a Grengine that works with Grape, eliminating also a Groovy issue related to Grape (GROOVY-7407).

      • Grengine

        public Grengine(File dir)
        constructor for a Grengine based on scripts in a given script directory, without subdirectories, and with a top code cache.

        Script extensions are the single extension "groovy".

        Load modes are "current first" for the script directory code layer and "parent first" for the top code cache.

        Constructed from builders with otherwise default settings.

        Call getLastUpdateException() after constructing if you need to make sure all sources can be compiled without errors.

        Parameters:
        dir - script directory
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the directory is null
        Since:
        1.0

      • Grengine

        public Grengine(org.codehaus.groovy.control.CompilerConfiguration config,
                File dir)
        constructor for a Grengine based on scripts in a given script directory, without subdirectories, and with a top code cache.

        Script extensions are taken from the given compiler configuration, which defaults to the single extension "groovy".

        Load modes are "current first" for the script directory code layer and "parent first" for the top code cache.

        Constructed from builders with otherwise default settings.

        Call getLastUpdateException() after constructing if you need to make sure all sources can be compiled without errors.

        Parameters:
        config - compiler configuration to use for compiling all sources
        dir - script directory
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null
        Since:
        1.0

      • Grengine

        public Grengine(Collection<URL> urls)
        constructor for a Grengine based on a collection of URL-based scripts, with a top code cache, and with tracking URLs based on content.

        Load modes are "current first" for the script directory code layer and "parent first" for the top code cache.

        Uses a DefaultSourceFactory with tracking URL content set to true. Constructed from builders with otherwise default settings.

        Call getLastUpdateException() after constructing if you need to make sure all sources can be compiled without errors.

        Parameters:
        urls - collection of URL-based scripts
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the URL collection is null
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadMainClass

        public Class<?> loadMainClass(Loader loader,
                              Source source)
        Description copied from class: BaseGrengine
        loads the main class of the given source from the given loader.

        Note that if a class with the main class name is available for loading, but was not compiled as part of a set of Source that included the given source, that class will not count for loading.

        Specified by:
        loadMainClass in class BaseGrengine
        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        source - source
        Returns:
        main class
        See Also:
        Engine.loadMainClass(Loader loader, Source source)

      • loadClass

        public Class<?> loadClass(Loader loader,
                          String name)
        Description copied from class: BaseGrengine
        loads a class by name from the given loader.

        Note that a top code cache is not searched in this case, because each set of source has its own top loader.

        Specified by:
        loadClass in class BaseGrengine
        Parameters:
        loader - loader
        name - class name
        Returns:
        class
        See Also:
        Engine.loadClass(Loader loader, String name)
